Doc: Message for assertion of payments to be reconciled. Notification message that submits cashflows that need to be reconciled per payment date at the trade level.

Source.Contents:
/#
   Message for assertion of payments to be reconciled. Notification message that submits cashflows that need to be reconciled per payment date at the trade level.
 #/
record FpML5.reporting.TradeCashflowsAsserted {
  header : FpML5.reporting.NotificationMessageHeader?

  # A list of validation sets the sender asserts the document is valid with respect to.
  validation : string?

  # An optional identifier used to correlate between related processes
  parentCorrelationId : string?

  # A qualified identifier used to correlate between messages
  correlationId : string?

  # A numeric value that can be used to order messages with the same correlation identifier from the same sender.
  sequenceNumber : int( 1, * )?

  # Indicates which party (or parties) (and accounts) a trade or event is being processed for. Normally there will only be a maximum of 2 parties, but in the case of a novation there could be a transferor, transferee, remaining party, and other remaining party. Also, in the context of a trade package there could be several parties for which limit check is requested, necessitating multiple onBehalfOf elements. Except for these cases, there should be no more than two onBehalfOf references in a message.
  onBehalfOf : FpML5.reporting.OnBehalfOf?

  # The date and time at which the set of cashflows was defined.
  asOfDate : datetime?

  # The specific characteristics included in the report.
  reportContents : FpML5.reporting.ReportContents?

  # Unique identifier assigned by the party asserting the set of cashflows to be reconciled.
  tradeCashflowsId : string?

  # Structure that holds reference to the trade through the tradeId and optionally some trade-specific elements for identifying the trade in the case of trades that have not been negotiated through electronic platforms and for which the counterparty's trade ID has not been captured.
  tradeIdentifyingItems : FpML5.reporting.TradeIdentifyingItems?

  # The adjusted date in which the payments are being paid/received.
  adjustedPaymentDate : date?

  # Specifies the payment that is exposed to the matching process. Usually there will be a single payment but for cross-currency swaps a different payment per currency shall be provided.
  payment : FpML5.reporting.PaymentMatching?

  # A unique identifier assigned by either party, or matching service, as agreed, to each set of matched cashflows.
  matchId : string?

  # Parties can perform multiple roles in a trade lifecycle. For example, the principal parties obligated to make payments from time to time during the term of the trade, but may include other parties involved in, or incidental to, the trade, such as parties acting in the role of novation transferor/transferee, broker, calculation agent, etc. In FpML roles are defined in multiple places within a document.
  party : FpML5.reporting.Party?

  # Optional account information used to precisely define the origination and destination of financial instruments.
  account : FpML5.reporting.Account?

  fpmlVersion : string

  expectedBuild : int( 1, * )?

  actualBuild : int( 1, * )?

}

validation.Doc: A list of validation sets the sender asserts the document is valid with respect to.
validation.Name: validation

parentCorrelationId.Name: parentCorrelationId

correlationId.Doc: A qualified identifier used to correlate between messages

Normally there will only be a maximum of 2 parties, but in the case of a novation there could be a transferor, transferee, remaining party, and other remaining party. Also, in the context of a trade package there could be several parties for which limit check is requested, necessitating multiple onBehalfOf elements. Except for these cases, there should be no more than two onBehalfOf references in a message.
onBehalfOf.Name: onBehalfOf

asOfDate.Doc: The date and time at which the set of cashflows was defined.
asOfDate.Name: asOfDate

reportContents.Doc: The specific characteristics included in the report.
reportContents.Name: reportContents

tradeCashflowsId.Doc: Unique identifier assigned by the party asserting the set of cashflows to be reconciled.
tradeCashflowsId.Name: tradeCashflowsId

tradeIdentifyingItems.Doc: Structure that holds reference to the trade through the tradeId and optionally some trade-specific elements for identifying the trade in the case of trades that have not been negotiated through electronic platforms and for which the counterparty's trade ID has not been captured.
tradeIdentifyingItems.Name: tradeIdentifyingItems

adjustedPaymentDate.Doc: The adjusted date in which the payments are being paid/received.
adjustedPaymentDate.Name: adjustedPaymentDate

payment.Doc: Specifies the payment that is exposed to the matching process. Usually there will be a single payment but for cross-currency swaps a different payment per currency shall be provided.
payment.Name: payment

matchId.Doc: A unique identifier assigned by either party, or matching service, as agreed, to each set of matched cashflows.
matchId.Name: matchId

party.Doc: Parties can perform multiple roles in a trade lifecycle. For example, the principal parties obligated to make payments from time to time during the term of the trade, but may include other parties involved in, or incidental to, the trade, such as parties acting in the role of novation transferor/transferee, broker, calculation agent, etc. In FpML roles are defined in multiple places within a document.
party.Name: party

account.Doc: Optional account information used to precisely define the origination and destination of financial instruments.
account.Name: account
